00100 #define TRACE(x) \
00101 {\
00102         std::ostringstream out;\
00103 \
00104         out << x ;\
00105         SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBWDebug::trace(out.str().c_str(), __FILE__, __LINE__);\
00106 }
00107 
00108 #else
00109 #define TRACE(x) {;}
00110 #endif
00111 #endif

00138 
00143         static char DirectorySeparator()
00144         {
00145 #ifdef WIN32
00146                 return '\\' ;
00147 #else
00148                 return '/' ;
00149 #endif
00150         }
00151

00157         {

00160 #else
00161                 return "so" ;
00162 #endif

00173 class SBWOSLibrary
00174 {
00175 public:
00176         SBWOSLibrary(const char *szLibrary)
00177 #ifdef WIN32
00178         {
00179                 char *str = strdup(szLibrary);
00180                 char *szup = strupr(str);
00181                 m_handle = LoadLibrary(szup);
00182                 //char buffer[1000];
00183                 //sprintf(buffer, "loaded %s with handle %d", szLibrary, m_handle);
00184         //MessageBox(NULL, buffer, "In SBWOSLibrary", MB_OK);
00185                 free(str);
00186                 if (m_handle == NULL)
00187                         SBWOS::ThrowError();
00188         }
00189 #endif
00190 
00191         ~SBWOSLibrary()
00192 #ifdef WIN32
00193         {
00194                 //char buffer[1000];
00195                 //sprintf(buffer, "about to free library with handle %d", m_handle);
00196         //MessageBox(NULL, buffer, "In SBWOSLibrary", MB_OK);
00197                 //FreeLibrary(m_handle);
00198         }
00199 #endif
00200 
00201         void *getFunction(char *szFunction)
00202 #ifdef WIN32
00203         {
00204                 FARPROC pFunction = GetProcAddress(m_handle, szFunction);
00205 
00206                 if (pFunction == NULL)
00207                         SBWOS::ThrowError();
00208 
00209                 return (void *)pFunction ;
00210         }
00211 #endif
00212 
00213 private:
00214 
00215 #ifdef WIN32
00216         HINSTANCE m_handle ;
00217 #endif
00218 };

00220 #endif

00262 class SBWOSMutexLock
00263 {
00264 public :
00269         SBWOSMutexLock(SBWOSMutex &m) : mutex(m) { m.lock(); }
00270 
00272         ~SBWOSMutexLock() { mutex.unLock(); }
00273

00276         SBWOSMutex &mutex ;
